channel.title: The New York Times Trends
channel.description: 用中文浏览纽约时报热门报道

item.title: In an unannounced trip to Ukraine, Dr. Jill Biden, the first lady, met with Ukraine’s first lady, Olena Zelenska, in a town a few miles away from the border with Slovakia. https://t.co/CZDPWucUHw https://t.co/7dCFVA3Cx3

Patron, an expert bomb finder and perhaps Ukraine's smallest fighter, has been honored by the country's president.
He has found more than 200 Russian explosives, President Volodymyr Zelenksy said, and also helps children learn about mine safety. https://t.co/dmJ37qU0tf https://t.co/yn3xH0dV6Q

The headquarters of an anti-abortion group in Madison, Wis., was set on fire Sunday morning in an act of vandalism that included the attempted use of a Molotov cocktail and graffiti that read "If abortions aren’t safe then you aren’t either," police said. https://t.co/Ly0jEAAiOw

George Pérez, a celebrated comic book artist and writer who gave new life to Wonder Woman in the 1980s and helped create series for DC Comics and Marvel Comics that brought together some of the biggest heroes of the comics world, has died at 67. https://t.co/lX14moOYtC https://t.co/Vf2xQHmex4

Jill Biden met Ukraine’s first lady, Olena Zelenska, in an unannounced trip to western Ukraine on Sunday. Dr. Biden's full-throated call for an end to the war reflected bolder steps the Biden administration has taken to move against Russian aggression. https://t.co/e2O4e368dZ https://t.co/1TUNfwRiOY

U2 frontman Bono visited the grounds of a church in Bucha, Ukraine, where a mass grave was found in March after Russian troops withdrew from the town. Earlier Sunday, Bono and his bandmate the Edge performed in a Kyiv metro station. https://t.co/w4yDSxQbhn https://t.co/jvw0e4t1qf

More than half of the women and girls of reproductive age in the U.S. live in 28 states that could seek to ban or further restrict access to abortion if the Supreme Court were to overturn Roe v. Wade. See our analysis of those states. https://t.co/360gbAvSXT

Prime Minister Justin Trudeau of Canada has made an unannounced visit to Ukraine. Local officials posted photos of the premier touring devastation in the town of Irpin, a suburb of Kyiv. https://t.co/4jQJl7LSq8 https://t.co/WcwaFjX1ai

Ncuti Gatwa, a star of the Netflix series “Sex Education,” will be the 14th actor and first Black man to play the title role in “Doctor Who,” the long-running British science fiction franchise about a time-traveling adventurer, the BBC announced on Sunday. https://t.co/S3ZD6sAojr
Breaking News: In an upset, Rich Strike, the longest shot on the board at 80-1, won the 148th Kentucky Derby in front of the first full crowd at Churchill Downs since 2019. https://t.co/MFEtQ0LXfo

Since the Taliban seized control of Afghanistan, women have been subjected to a cascade of restrictions on employment, education, travel and other aspects of public life. Many assumed the return of a burqa-style body covering was the inevitable next step. https://t.co/1TwbXfWmVa https://t.co/j9qGy1izBw

Dozens of people are feared dead after a Russian airstrike leveled a school in eastern Ukraine. If the death toll is as high as local officials fear, it could be one of the deadliest single attacks since Russia renewed its offensive in the region. https://t.co/AYK201oqx4 https://t.co/q41QExXU7R

A marble bust was sold for $34.99 at a Goodwill store in Austin, Texas, in 2018. Turns out, it was an actual Roman bust from the late 1st century BC or early 1st century AD.
How it got to Texas remains a mystery. https://t.co/cgbMZOxyJJ

Breaking News: Jill Biden, the first lady, traveled to western Ukraine in an unannounced trip Sunday. She met Ukraine’s first lady, Olena Zelenska, in a town that has seen its population double with the arrival of people fleeing from elsewhere in Ukraine. https://t.co/JON0YhJlsM

Rich Strike, an 80-1 shot ridden by Sonny Leon and trained by Eric Reed, rallied to capture the 148th Kentucky Derby. Before Friday morning, Rich Strike wasn't even in the field.
"This is the most unbelievable day ever possible," Reed said after the race. https://t.co/HVKjZakuRh https://t.co/19PBh8ByqD

Gilgeori Toast is a popular salty-sweet egg sandwich sold by street-food vendors in Korea. Eaten for breakfast or lunch, it’s quick, easy and adaptable. If you don’t have cabbage on hand, toss in any vegetables you have that would add crunch and flavor. https://t.co/atjk1X2htB https://t.co/YQGzkw9lJl

Finding the right sofa for your space and budget begins with deciding what type and style you want. These @wirecutter tips will help you find a sofa that will be an investment in your current and future home. https://t.co/ekQGYuxnaR https://t.co/T4AaZg6vMN

When a new landlord bought their building in the Bronx and threatened to raise rents and kick them out, tenants banded together. They never expected how far they might get: the chance to buy their apartments for $2,500 each. https://t.co/EvZIYwkRX4 https://t.co/3hENvXtDHZ

Emmanuel Macron was inaugurated on Saturday for a second term as president of France. In a sober speech lasting less than ten minutes, Macron seemed determined to project a new humility, vowing to lead more inclusively. https://t.co/fyggNV8eJG https://t.co/vWxdz23IH3

A court in Belarus sentenced a 24-year-old Russian law student whose boyfriend is a prominent dissident to six years in prison on Friday. This comes nearly a year after the country’s authorities diverted a commercial flight to Minsk to arrest them. https://t.co/St2WfkUqyT

Two-thirds of working parents meet the criteria for parental burnout, a new report says. The nonclinical term means they are so exhausted by the pressure of caring for their children, they feel they have nothing left to give. https://t.co/I44vCGPkg7
Jill Biden, the first lady, visited a school in Romania’s capital that has taken in Ukrainian students displaced amid Russia’s invasion. https://t.co/YcqRl0FWWN https://t.co/3PHKBKv4FN

The Taliban government decreed Saturday that Afghan women must cover themselves from head to toe, expanding a series of restrictions on women that dictate nearly every aspect of public life. https://t.co/H04n8uVlxr

Ed Koch created the modern template of a brash big-city mayor. He also strained to conceal a basic fact of his life: He was gay. Now, friends in whom Koch confided want to complete the record, telling the New York Times it belongs to the sweep of history. https://t.co/bWxxImPLtw https://t.co/vWSyoRKJrR

Two-thirds of working parents meet the criteria for parental burnout, a new report says. The nonclinical term means they are so exhausted by the pressure of caring for their children, they feel they have nothing left to give. https://t.co/IWceUCPf6x https://t.co/0kWpY62Zrr

Jill Biden, the first lady, met with Ukrainian refugees in Romania on Saturday. At a public school in the country’s capital, she listened to stories from women who fled Russian bombs and visited with children who said their only wish was to return home. https://t.co/Xry3sXJZfC https://t.co/LfSLa9g8J8

The Kremlin entered the war in Ukraine expecting a quick and painless victory, predicting that Ukrainians in the east would gladly join its side.
That plan has failed spectacularly. https://t.co/eB4KyQzIv8

Ukrainian troops, emboldened by weapons supplied by the West, went on the offensive Friday against Russian forces in the northeast, seeking to drive them back from two key cities as the war plunged deeper into a grinding, town-for-town battle. https://t.co/45b1rdCcOi

After weeks of investigation, Italian authorities announced late Friday evening that they had impounded a nearly $700 million superyacht, saying that its owner had “significant economic and business links” to “prominent elements of the Russian government.” https://t.co/3oC9s8Pesv

Mattea Roach ended her “Jeopardy!” streak on Friday, winning 23 straight games and earning $560,983 (plus a $2000 consolation prize for her loss). She is among the show’s winningest regular-season players. https://t.co/0x0InPlX40

A federal judge in San Francisco on Friday dismissed Donald Trump’s lawsuit against Twitter over the social media company’s decision to bar him from its platform permanently after the Jan. 6 attack at the U.S. Capitol. https://t.co/numfrtQv9w

If the Supreme Court's draft opinion overturning Roe v. Wade becomes final, poor women will feel the brunt of it as some states ban abortion, @sangerkatz tells @AsteadWesley. Listen to their full conversation. https://t.co/shSP0jtFcP https://t.co/vYNh4lJitI
Here's what the U.S. would look like without Roe v. Wade. https://t.co/Cm9NtnutXR https://t.co/PgRkP3B6MX

When a new landlord bought their building in the Bronx and threatened to raise rents and kick them out, tenants banded together. They never expected how far they might get: the chance to buy their apartments for $2,500 each. https://t.co/EIz3VZoikU https://t.co/XdysUOZ0u5

Tesla is covering transportation costs for employees to get out-of-state abortions, according to a report it released on Friday. The company recently moved to Texas, which is home to some of the most restrictive abortion laws in the U.S. https://t.co/eUgaodSemF
Threatened with rent hikes and eviction, tenants of a Bronx building came together to fight the landlord. Now they are on the cusp of owning the building. https://t.co/Ym2EpmCMNS

The top UN human rights official said that her staff had documented scores of cases of Russian forces targeting male civilians around Kyiv.
Some were beaten or executed, and some were taken to detention camps inside Russia and Belarus, the official said. https://t.co/1OrHwObsIz

A marble bust was sold for $34.99 at a Goodwill store in Austin, Texas, in 2018. Turns out, it was an actual Roman bust from the late 1st century BC or early 1st century AD.
How it got to Texas remains a mystery. https://t.co/j1uE7tgVf0 https://t.co/yHl5EjKXOf
Breaking News: U.S. employers added 428,000 jobs in April and average hourly earnings rose 5.5% from a year ago, signs of strength in the labor market. https://t.co/5tRS98mu7o

Jill Biden is leaving late Thursday for Eastern Europe, where she will visit with Ukrainian refugees displaced by the Russian invasion and tour the Slovakian border with Ukraine. https://t.co/NOU00rAjsl

The number of unruly air passenger incidents reached its lowest level in the U.S. since 2020, a week after a federal judge in Florida struck down a government mask mandate on public transportation, according to FAA data. https://t.co/hZensTzxSo

A marble bust was sold for $34.99 at a Goodwill store in Austin, Texas, in 2018. Turns out, it was an actual Roman bust from the late 1st century BC or early 1st century AD.
How it got to Texas remains a mystery. https://t.co/qo1UYzQ9wx
Breaking News: The FDA said it would limit the use of Johnson & Johnson’s Covid vaccine, citing safety concerns over a rare blood clotting disorder. https://t.co/9qJIkMG4AV

Nearly 15 million more people died during the first two years of the pandemic than would have been expected during pre-pandemic times, the WHO found. The previous death count, from countries’ reporting, was six million. https://t.co/fj6WmdcvLK https://t.co/VCmqsAyaKV

Surprise 🐰 Bad Bunny just released a new album, "Un Verano Sin Ti."
"The album is very Caribbean, in every sense: with its reggaeton, its mambo, with all those rhythms," he said in an exclusive interview. "And I like it that way." https://t.co/QOagkVhoDZ https://t.co/T12S8G0QA5

Cinco de Mayo has a history that runs deep and continues to serve as a vehicle conveying Mexican culture, pride and values.
Here are a few things to know about the day. https://t.co/pKAGVYexDu

A Maryland man who died two months after receiving a heart transplant from a genetically altered pig was infected with a virus that the animals are known to carry, according to the surgeon. The infection may have contributed to his death. https://t.co/uAnhhTemO3

Aleksandr Lukashenko, the authoritarian leader of Belarus and close ally of President Vladimir Putin, said Russia’s invasion had "dragged on" and called for an end to the "war," using a word that the Kremlin has assiduously avoided. https://t.co/92ywHzHo6Q
Breaking News: The U.S. provided targeting information that helped Ukrainian forces locate and strike the flagship of Russia’s Black Sea fleet last month. https://t.co/pdmluD7yqG

Donald Trump asked his then-defense secretary, Mark Esper, about the possibility of launching missiles into Mexico to “destroy the drug labs” and wipe out the cartels, Esper said in his upcoming memoir. https://t.co/HsaD7M1GQX
